answers.answer: Hello I am a nurse so I can tell you a couple things (I'm only like 5 weeks prego with my first!). Some babies with mom's with gestational diabetes are born too big and are at risk for low blood sugar when they are born (mothers with high blood sugars feed the baby that sugar). Not to worry. You will see an endocrinologist and they will help you! You may be controlled by diet you may need insulin. All the best in your pregnancy!

This makes my 2nd pregnancy with this problem. Everything smooth with my birth of my daughter and I expect it to be normal with this little girl. I currently take 2000mg of metphormin a day and 4 shots of insulin a day. Your fine momma calm down. Just make sure you keep a good, steady, healthy diet and keep check of your sugar levels. Feel free to friend me on FB @roger n Mandy Holliman that way if you need to talk to someone....

question: Has anyone given birth with gestational diabetes? How is and what to expect. I was diagnosed today and can't help but to  feel worried..
title: someone please answer!!
